title: Why Gen Z's 'VSCO girls' are abandoning Instagram
text:
“Woah!”, says Joel Flory, leaning over the long wooden table in the sun-drenched warehouse offices of his photography app, VSCO.

“Just launched right now! That’s so cool!”, he says, grinning and gesturing to a new set of curated images of blue sky and clouds that his staff has uploaded to the app, designed to inspire users to take their own pictures of the stratosphere.

At almost 40, Flory wearing a hoodie and an Oakland A's baseball cap, is still boyishly excited about his creation.

A native of Oakland, the city across the bay from San Francisco, he has none of the cautious, corporate stiffness of Mark Zuckerberg, the chief executive of Facebook, which owns VSCO’s rival Instagram (you may have...
